title: statikk shiv vs infinity edge which is first to wear on quinn?
body: i wored statikk shiv on quinn and i find it more usefull then infinity edge first in order but infinity edge stats r more hotter so im just wondering which should i wear first on quinn?

replies.body:
Are you an adc? Yes.

Are you Vayne? No.

Then your first completed item should be bloodthirster or infinity edge. BT if you're winning lane and can get farm, IE if you're losing and dying

AS is useless without AD to back it up.
I agree... I mean, your comment is only wrong on vayne but or everyone else that is so true

Well I'd say the IE, but I'd say you should get BT if you aren't extremely ahead, but if you have a significant advantage in lane I'd definitely go for the IE. I guess that's just me but the IE pushes an advantage harder because it gives A lot more damage thanks to the crit chance, but the higher cost of the item and the survivabilty a BT gives you is definitely something to take into account.
oh lol oh yeah lol thnx

Im assuming you mean playing her ADC.

Personally I wouldn't get either during lane phase. The answer to your question is to get Shiv first. Its passive is strong early game and it has solid attack speed, and movement speed, and a decent crit chance. The thing is, IE gives 70 AD, which is exactly what Quinn needs, raw AD. But its passive bonus to Crit Strike is just a waste of gold if you have no other crit items. Basically its best to get your crit items before your IE. 

Personal note about how i play quinn, you can play her so many different ways, but my favorite is to just get tons of AD early game. I rush Bloodthirstier, then get Ninja Tabi, then Last Whisper. Get Phantom Dancers as your 4th item and then IE. What you want to do is wait for Valor to mark the enemy ADC, then shoot them, and then vault and shoot them again. This combo can take over 2/3 of an enemies health with this build, and can even kill them in one go if you have even the slightest gold advantage. 

This is still a totally personal way of playing her, and her kit is so variable that there's plenty other viable methods, but there is nothing more satisfying as killing a Caitlin before she even knew you attacked.
